intro: Smilacina racemosa var. brachystyla, commonly known as the short-stalked greenbriar, is a deciduous vine native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by bright red berries that attract birds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of understory plant communities in eastern North American forests.
